input_text:
Job Title: Software Engineer Intern

Location: Knoxville, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Company DescriptionThe University of Tennessee, located in Knoxville, is a public land-grant university and the flagship institution of the statewide University of Tennessee system. With nine undergraduate departments and eleven graduate departments, the university hosts more than 26,000 students from all 50 states and over 100 foreign countries. As a co-manager of Oak Ridge National Laboratory, the University offers extensive research opportunities for faculty and students. . Home to the Great Smokey Mountains National Park, Knoxville offers unrivaled access to nature and the great outdoors.
Role DescriptionThe Complex Systems Monitoring Optimization and Stability Laboratory, or COSMOS lab for short, is an applied AI lab at the University of Tennessee. We work on cutting-edge research in areas such as Homeland Security, Autonomous Vehicles, Transportation, and Manufacturing.
This is an NSF REU internship program (research experience for undergraduates). Unlike typical REUs, this promises to be highly applied, giving you a chance to build real-world AI products for Security applications based on our years of research.
Please Google "NSF Award #1932033", or watch this 4-minute Youtube Video https://youtu.be/_4uFVJYvHoY to learn more about our innovative research.
We are 5 years into this ambitious project and have developed multiple algorithmic breakthroughs. We are now trying to spin this off into a startup and are trying to productize our technological innovation into a usable product, designed to improve security responses and mitigate active-shooter scenarios - a multi-billion dollar market.
This is where you come in - If you have a background in API, App, or SaaS development and have knowledge about DBMS, SQL, MapReduce, Cloud, DevOps etc., and are excited about our research, we would love to hear from you.We would love to extend an offer to join our startup as a Founding Engineer/CTO if we love your work. Looking forward to your application.
Benefits:Competitive pay with mentorship from PhD studentsCollaboration with the Dept. of Homeland Security Center of ExcellencePotential to join full-time as a Founding Engineer/CTO in our startup spinoffOpportunity to build real-world AI products for Security applications
Qualifications:U.S. citizen/LPR registered in an undergraduate program.Strong background in Computer Science and Software DevelopmentExperience with App, API, or GUI DevelopmentKnowledge about SQL, DBMS, MapReduce, Cloud & DevOps are a plusProficiency in programming languages (Python, C, C++)Knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) conceptsAbility to work independently and in a team. High agency is expectedExcellent problem-solving and analytical skillsGood communication and interpersonal skills

Experience Level (if available): None

It hosts more than 26,000 students from all 50 states and over 100 foreign countries. As a co-manager of Oak Ridge National Laboratory, the University offers extensive research opportunities for faculty and students.
